Name: Tbilisi
Description: The capital city and the cultural, economic, and political center of Georgia, known for its historical sites, including Narikala Fortress and Rustaveli Avenue.

Name: Adjara
Description: A coastal region on the Black Sea, known for its tourism, Batumi, and a mix of seaside and mountainous landscapes.

Name: Imereti
Description: A central region of Georgia, known for its fertile lands, vineyards, and historical towns such as Kutaisi.

Name: Kakheti
Description: The eastern region, famous for its wine production, vineyards, and the Alazani River Valley.

Name: Kvemo Kartli
Description: A region located south of Tbilisi, known for its diverse landscapes, including plains, forests, and rivers.

Name: Mtskheta-Mtianeti
Description: A mountainous region, home to Mtskheta, an ancient city and UNESCO World Heritage site, and stunning landscapes of the Caucasus mountains.

Name: Racha-Lechkhumi and Kvemo Svaneti
Description: A region known for its mountainous terrain, rivers, and traditional culture, with Svaneti being a key tourist destination.

Name: Samegrelo-Zemo Svaneti
Description: A region in western Georgia known for its Black Sea coast, as well as Svaneti, and its unique cultural heritage.

Name: Samtskhe-Javakheti
Description: A region in southern Georgia, famous for its diverse ethnic groups, churches, and picturesque landscapes.

Name: Shida Kartli
Description: Located in central Georgia, this region is rich in history, with ancient ruins and historical sites such as Uplistsikhe.
